item.title: Human Excrement on the floor and tissues left on the footpath, 22nd October
item.description:
Resident reporting there is a lot of human excrement & tissues on the pavement round the corner of No 47, there is a lamp post nearby and it is opposite this and the telephone post. Resident has tried to bleach it but it is stuck. There is some on the resident's fence where someone has stood up and done this. It happened this morning Please could this get cleaned asap as it is a busy footway
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 291, Old Farm Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large tree in Garden of 21 Burma Road, 22nd October
item.description:
Tree has grown and overhangs multiple neighbouring properties. The tree drops a large amount of debris, which regularly blocks drainage systems causing water damage and mould to properties even a few doors down. It’s too tall to access for a boundary cut.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Burma Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Someones dumped large peices of wood down the bet between houses, 22nd October
item.description:
I came back today to my home at 5 Bromley Gardens, to see that someones dumped large peices of wood down our alley and i checked to see if it was anyone else who i live with and it wasn't

item.title: Northfield House recycling bins ongoing issues, 22nd October
item.description:
Please see the two pics attached - one of the bins at Frensham end, the other at Old Kent/Peckham Park Road end of Northfield House carpark. The Frensham Street bins have been emptied today (Wed 22 Oct) as usual with the regular recycling collection. The others, however, have been left in this state. The bin on the left has been emptied but the bin on the right has for the past few weeks been marked "do not use" - but has been left in place, with the result that it keeps getting used. It is not acceptable to mark a bin, leave it in place, and then not empty it. It has been like this for over a fortnight now. If the bin is no longer usable, it needs to be removed and replaced, not just ignored. And as for the rubbish on the ground, why it has been left there by the collectors today, I do not know. This ongoing bins situation at this site is unfair on residents and Southwark itself and an eyesore and a health hazard. We do our best to keep Northfield nice, but Southwark is really failing us here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham Park Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of rubbish in alleyway, 22nd October
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping, 22nd October
item.description:
I have attached the pictures of these two men dumping their concrete bags. It has been happening every other day. As soon as waste collection is taken away these men and others bring their rubbish to dump here. This place is located SE9 5ED Eltham hill. Because of dirt spread everywhere our house block looks like a junk yard and people repeatedly keep doing it. I had reported before but no action was taken and reporting it again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 134-144, Eltham Hill, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin men not doing their job, 22nd October
item.description:
I have placed in this address temporarily and have been here almost 3 weeks now. Explain why the bin men are taking everyone else's recyclables and rubbish, and not ours? I am sick of this now! I stopped them in person last weel and they told me it doesnt matter which bin I put things in, they will take it. And they haven't AGAIN. I will be fly tipping my rubbish if this isnt rectified.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waratah Drive, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inappropriate Parking Location, 22nd October
item.description:
The section of road immediately in front of 27 Thistlefield Cl is not long enough to safely park a vehicle. Despite this, it is regularly used for parking which obstructs either or both of the driveways on either side of it - something I understand to be an offence according to the highway code. When cars are parked here it causes an obstruction on the street for larger vans or lorries (including garbage collection vehicles) who cannot easily or safely pass. It also causes obstruction to the residents of 25, 26, 27, 28 and 29 Thistlefield Cl who have allocated parking here as well as visitors or delivery vehicles to this area. Recently, a lorry hit a car parked in this section of road when trying to exit the parking area/driveway, because a car was parked part way across the driveway and the lorry could not make a complete turn left out of the driveway. This section of road should be marked with double yellow lines to maintain safe access and egress both to the rest of Thistlefield Close and the driveways and allocated parking surrounding it. Alternatively, wardens should patrol this area more frequently to deter the recent increase of inappropriate parking here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Thistlefield Close, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
